cards.han: A namespace is a naming system used to make sure that names are unique to avoid naming conflicts

It is an environment variable which is used when a module is imported. Whenever a module is imported, PYTHONPATH is also looked up to check for the presence of the imported modules in various directories. The interpreter uses it to determine which module to load.

cards.eng: What are python modules? Name some commonly used built-in modules in Python?
cards.han: Python modules are files containing Python code. This code can either be functions classes or variables. A Python module is a .py file containing executable code.

cards.eng: What is type conversion in Python?
cards.han: Type conversion refers to the conversion of one data type iinto another.

cards.eng: What is the difference between Python Arrays and lists
cards.han: Arrays and lists, in Python, have the same way of storing data. But, arrays can hold only a single data type elements whereas lists can hold any data type elements.
A function is a block of code which is executed only when it is called. To define a Python function, the def keyword is used
__init__ is a method or constructor in Python. This method is automatically called to allocate memory when a new object/ instance of a class is created. All classes have the __init__ method.
An anonymous function is known as a lambda function. This function can have any number of parameters but, can have just one statement.

Self is an instance or an object of a class. In Python, this is explicitly included as the first parameter. However, this is not the case in Java where itâ€™s optional.  It helps to differentiate between the methods and attributes of a class with local variables. The self variable in the init method refers to the newly created object while in other methods, it refers to the object whose method was called.
[::-1] is used to reverse the order of an array or a sequence.
Iterators are objects which can be traversed though or iterated upon.
